page.title: 12RECREATION.
page.content: The village has easy access to much of the North Norfolk Coast,providing one has a car. Within the village there is a playing field for use as a cricket pitch. Formerly there were also two football teams. These are unlikely to be revived as so many houses are only used at weekends or in the summer and the resident population can no longer provide enough young men to make up the teams. There is a flourishing bowls club. Outside the village it is possible to sail, play golf and fly light aircraft. The Gallows sports centre at Fakenham provides additional facilities for the residents who are able to travel using their own transport. Recreational evening classes at Fakenham and Wells are also used by the people in the village.
